result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

The Court finds that the Defendants waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary.  State to file an information.  Court sets for arraignment.
Defendant waives his right to a Preliminary Hearing.

09:27 AM Andrew Nesheim appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Daubon L Pena in court, in custody, with attorney Jeffery Joy.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Defendant prepared to waive the preliminary hearing.  Arraignment scheduled for July 27, 2022 at 08:15 am.

Atty joy requests to appear via zoom for 7/13 hearing. Court's response: I have already denied a motion to appear at all hearings electronically as being too broad. The preliminary hearing MAY be held via Zoom but there must first be a waiver form filed within 48 hrs of prelim date
